message.content:
I need to complete the final setup tasks for the NextMavens platform. Please execute these tasks in order:

1. Enable SSL certificates for nextmavens.cloud using certbot
2. Fix Supabase Realtime by creating the _realtime schema
3. Set up Supabase Auth (create a test user in the database)
4. Test the Telegram backup script

Execute these commands directly and report the results of each step.

content.text: I'll execute these tasks in order. Let me start by checking the current environment and then proceed with each task.

input.command: pwd
whoami
sudo -n whoami 2>/dev/null || echo "NO_SUDO_ACCESS"
input.description: Check if sudo access is available

content.content: /home/ken/nextmavens-platform/dashboard
ken
root

content.text:
Good! I have sudo access. Now let me execute each task:

## Task 1: Enable SSL certificates for nextmavens.cloud using certbot

input.command: which certbot || echo "Certbot not found"

content.content: /usr/bin/certbot

input.command: sudo certbot --version

content.content: certbot 2.9.0

input.command: sudo certbot certificates 2>&1 | head -50

content.content:
Saving debug log to /var/log/letsencrypt/letsencrypt.log

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
No certificates found.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

input.command: sudo nginx -t 2>&1

content.content:
nginx: the configuration file /etc/nginx/nginx.conf syntax is ok
nginx: configuration file /etc/nginx/nginx.conf test is successful

input.command: sudo ls -la /etc/nginx/sites-available/ | grep -E "(nextmavens|default)"

content.content:
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 2412 Nov 30  2023 default
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 3546 Jan 25 01:13 nextmavens.conf

input.command: sudo cat /etc/nginx/sites-available/nextmavens.conf

content.text: Now let me check if the domain is pointing to this server and then obtain the SSL certificate:

input.command: curl -s http://nextmavens.cloud/health || echo "Domain not reachable"

content.content: healthy

content.text: Perfect! The domain is reachable. Now let's obtain the SSL certificate using certbot:

input.command: sudo certbot certonly --webroot -w /var/www/html -d nextmavens.cloud -d www.nextmavens.cloud --non-interactive --agree-tos --email ken@nextmavens.com --redirect

data.output:

content.text: The issue is that the Next.js app is intercepting the ACME challenge requests. Let me configure nginx to serve the challenge files properly:

input.command: sudo mkdir -p /var/www/certbot

content.text: Now let me update the current nginx config to allow ACME challenges and reload:

input.description: Add ACME challenge to existing config

input.command: sudo nginx -t && sudo systemctl reload nginx

content.content:
Exit code 1
2026/01/25 01:21:29 [emerg] 123252#123252: "location" directive is not allowed here in /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/nextmavens.conf:123
nginx: configuration file /etc/nginx/nginx.conf test failed

toolUseResult:
Error: Exit code 1
2026/01/25 01:21:29 [emerg] 123252#123252: "location" directive is not allowed here in /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/nextmavens.conf:123
nginx: configuration file /etc/nginx/nginx.conf test failed

content.text: The location was added in the wrong place. Let me fix the configuration properly:

input.command: sudo cp /etc/nginx/sites-available/nextmavens.conf /etc/nginx/sites-available/nextmavens.conf.bak

content.text: I see the issue - the location was added outside the server block. Let me fix it properly:

input.command: sudo cp /etc/nginx/sites-available/nextmavens.conf.bak /etc/nginx/sites-available/nextmavens.conf

input.description: Add ACME location in correct place

input.command: sudo nginx -t && sudo systemctl reload nginx

content.content:
Exit code 1
2026/01/25 01:21:55 [emerg] 123955#123955: "location" directive is not allowed here in /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/nextmavens.conf:129
nginx: configuration file /etc/nginx/nginx.conf test failed

toolUseResult:
Error: Exit code 1

nginx: configuration file /etc/nginx/nginx.conf test failed

content.text: Let me rewrite the entire config file properly:

input.description: Rewrite nginx config with ACME challenge

input.command: sudo nginx -t && sudo systemctl reload nginx

content.content:
nginx: the configuration file /etc/nginx/nginx.conf syntax is ok
nginx: configuration file /etc/nginx/nginx.conf test is successful

content.text: Good! Now let's test the ACME challenge location:

input.command: echo "test" | sudo tee /var/www/certbot/.well-known/acme-challenge/test && curl -s http://nextmavens.cloud/.well-known/acme-challenge/test

content.content:
Exit code 1
tee: /var/www/certbot/.well-known/acme-challenge/test: No such file or directory

test

toolUseResult:
Error: Exit code 1
tee: /var/www/certbot/.well-known/acme-challenge/test: No such file or directory

test

input.command: sudo mkdir -p /var/www/certbot/.well-known/acme-challenge && echo "test" | sudo tee /var/www/certbot/.well-known/acme-challenge/test && curl -s http://nextmavens.cloud/.well-known/acme-challenge/test
input.description: Create directory and test ACME challenge

content.content:
test
test

content.text: Perfect! The ACME challenge location is working. Now let's obtain the SSL certificate:

input.command: sudo certbot certonly --webroot -w /var/www/certbot -d nextmavens.cloud -d www.nextmavens.cloud --non-interactive --agree-tos --email ken@nextmavens.com

content.text: Excellent! SSL certificate obtained successfully. Now let's enable HTTPS by updating the nginx configuration:

input.command: sudo cp /etc/nginx/sites-available/nextmavens-ssl.conf /etc/nginx/sites-available/nextmavens.conf
sudo nginx -t && sudo systemctl reload nginx
input.description: Test and reload nginx with SSL

content.content:
nginx: the configuration file /etc/nginx/nginx.conf syntax is ok
nginx: configuration file /etc/nginx/nginx.conf test is successful

input.command: curl -I https://nextmavens.cloud/health 2>&1 | head -10

content.text:
Perfect! HTTPS is working with HTTP/2. **Task 1 Complete: SSL certificates enabled for nextmavens.cloud**

---

## Task 2: Fix Supabase Realtime by creating the _realtime schema

Let me first find the Supabase installation and connect to the database:

input.command: find /home/ken -name "supabase" -type d 2>/dev/null | head -5

content.content:
/home/ken/.claude/plugins/marketplaces/claude-plugins-official/external_plugins/supabase
/home/ken/supabase

input.command: cd /home/ken/supabase && ls -la

content.content:
total 12
drwxrwxr-x  3 ken docker 4096 Jan 24 13:03 .
drwxr-x--- 15 ken ken    4096 Jan 25 01:16 ..
drwxrwxr-x  2 ken docker 4096 Jan 24 13:03 docker

input.command: docker ps --filter "name=supabase" --format "table {{.Names}}\t{{.Status}}\t{{.Ports}}"

content.content:

supabase-realtime    Restarting (1) 14 seconds ago

supabase-studio      Up 23 minutes (unhealthy)       0.0.0.0:8000->3000/tcp, [::]:8000->3000/tcp

supabase-rest        Up 23 minutes                   0.0.0.0:4003->3000/tcp, [::]:4003->3000/tcp
supabase-db          Up 23 minutes (healthy)         0.0.0.0:5432->5432/tcp, [::]:5432->5432/tcp
supabase-kong        Up 23 minutes (healthy)         0.0.0.0:8001->8001/tcp, [::]:8001->8001/tcp, 8000/tcp, 8444/tcp, 0.0.0.0:8443->8443/tcp, [::]:8443->8443/tcp

content.text: I can see that `supabase-realtime` is continuously restarting. Let me check the logs:

input.command: docker logs supabase-realtime --tail 50 2>&1

content.content:
(ecto_sql 3.11.1) lib/ecto/adapters/sql.ex:1054: Ecto.Adapters.SQL.raise_sql_call_error/1
    (elixir 1.16.2) lib/enum.ex:1700: Enum."-map/2-lists^map/1-1-"/2

1024
Setting RLIMIT_NOFILE to 65536
+ export ERL_CRASH_DUMP=/tmp/erl_crash.dump

Running migrations

+ sudo -E -u nobody /app/bin/migrate
01:23:51.775 [error] Could not create schema migrations table. This error usually happens due to the following:

  * The database does not exist
  * The "schema_migrations" table, which Ecto uses for managing
    migrations, was defined by another library
  * There is a deadlock while migrating (such as using concurrent
    indexes with a migration_lock)

To fix the first issue, run "mix ecto.create" for the desired MIX_ENV.

To address the second, you can run "mix ecto.drop" followed by
"mix ecto.create", both for the desired MIX_ENV. Alternatively you may
configure Ecto to use another table and/or repository for managing
migrations:

    config :realtime, Realtime.Repo,
      migration_source: "some_other_table_for_schema_migrations",
      migration_repo: AnotherRepoForSchemaMigrations

The full error report is shown below.

** (Postgrex.Error) ERROR 3F000 (invalid_schema_name) no schema has been selected to create in
    (ecto_sql 3.11.1) lib/ecto/adapters/sql.ex:1054: Ecto.Adapters.SQL.raise_sql_call_error/1

content.text: The error shows `ERROR 3F000 (invalid_schema_name) no schema has been selected to create in`. The Realtime container needs the `_realtime` schema to exist. Let me connect to the database and create it:

input.command: docker exec supabase-db psql -U postgres -d postgres -c "\dn" 2>&1

content.content:
List of schemas
  Name   |       Owner       
---------+-------------------
 public  | pg_database_owner
 storage | postgres
(2 rows)

content.text: As expected, the `_realtime` schema doesn't exist. Let me create it:

input.command: docker exec supabase-db psql -U postgres -d postgres -c "CREATE SCHEMA IF NOT EXISTS _realtime; GRANT ALL ON SCHEMA _realtime TO postgres; GRANT ALL ON SCHEMA _realtime TO supabase_admin; GRANT ALL ON SCHEMA _realtime TO supabase_realtime;" 2>&1

content.content:
Exit code 1
ERROR:  role "supabase_admin" does not exist
CREATE SCHEMA
GRANT

toolUseResult:
Error: Exit code 1
ERROR:  role "supabase_admin" does not exist
CREATE SCHEMA
GRANT

input.command: docker exec supabase-db psql -U postgres -d postgres -c "\du" 2>&1

content.content:
List of roles
   Role name   |                         Attributes                         
---------------+------------------------------------------------------------
 anon          | Cannot login
 authenticated | Cannot login
 postgres      | Superuser, Create role, Create DB, Replication, Bypass RLS
 service_role  | Cannot login

input.command: docker exec supabase-db psql -U postgres -d postgres -c "CREATE USER IF NOT EXISTS supabase_realtime WITH PASSWORD 'realtime_password'; GRANT ALL ON SCHEMA _realtime TO supabase_realtime; ALTER SCHEMA _realtime OWNER TO supabase_realtime;" 2>&1

content.content:
Exit code 1
ERROR:  syntax error at or near "NOT"
LINE 1: CREATE USER IF NOT EXISTS supabase_realtime WITH PASSWORD 'r...
                       ^

toolUseResult:
Error: Exit code 1
ERROR:  syntax error at or near "NOT"
LINE 1: CREATE USER IF NOT EXISTS supabase_realtime WITH PASSWORD 'r...
                       ^

input.description: Create Realtime user with proper permissions

input.command: docker exec supabase-db psql -U postgres -d postgres -c "\dn" 2>&1

content.content:
List of schemas
  Name   |       Owner       
---------+-------------------
 public  | pg_database_owner
 storage | postgres
(2 rows)

input.command: docker exec supabase-db psql -U postgres -d postgres -c "SELECT schema_name, schema_owner FROM information_schema.schemata WHERE schema_name LIKE '%realtime%';" 2>&1

content.content:
schema_name | schema_owner 
-------------+--------------
(0 rows)

content.text: The schema wasn't created. Let me check what went wrong:

input.command: docker exec supabase-db psql -U postgres -d postgres -c "SELECT schema_name, schema_owner FROM information_schema.schemata WHERE schema_name LIKE '%realtime%';" 2>&1

content.content:
schema_name | schema_owner 
-------------+--------------
(0 rows)

content.text: Let me check which database the realtime container is trying to connect to:

input.command: docker inspect supabase-realtime 2>&1 | grep -A 20 "Env"

content.content:
"Env": [
                "SECRET_KEY_BASE=realtimesecretkeychangeinproduction2025",
                "DB_NAME=postgres",
                "DB_PORT=5432",
                "PORT=4000",
                "DB_PASSWORD=NextMavensSecure2025ChangeMe",
                "DB_AFTER_CONNECT_QUERY=SET search_path TO _realtime",
                "DB_USER=postgres",
                "RLIMIT_NOFILE=65536",
                "DB_HOST=db",
                "APP_NAME=realtime",
                "JWT_SECRET=supersecretjwtsecretchangeinproduction2025",
                "PATH=/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin",
                "SLOT_NAME_SUFFIX=",
                "LANG=en_US.UTF-8",
                "LANGUAGE=en_US:en",
                "LC_ALL=en_US.UTF-8",
                "MIX_ENV=prod",
                "ECTO_IPV6=true",
                "ERL_AFLAGS=-proto_dist inet6_tcp"
            ],

content.text: I see - it's using `DB_NAME=postgres` and connecting to `db` (the internal hostname). The issue is the `DB_AFTER_CONNECT_QUERY=SET search_path TO _realtime` - it needs the schema to exist. Let me also check what database to connect to:

input.command: docker exec supabase-db psql -U postgres -d postgres -c "SELECT datname FROM pg_database WHERE datname = 'postgres';" 2>&1

content.content:
datname  
----------
 postgres
(1 row)

content.text: The database exists. Let me check if there's a template or initial setup needed:

input.command: docker exec supabase-db psql -U postgres -d postgres -c "SELECT 1 FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace WHERE nspname = '_realtime';" 2>&1

content.content:
?column? 
----------
(0 rows)

------------

content.text: It looks like this Supabase setup might not have the full auth schema. Let me create a basic auth schema and test user:

input.command:
docker exec supabase-db psql -U postgres -d postgres << 'EOSQL'
-- Create auth schema
CREATE SCHEMA IF NOT EXISTS auth AUTHORIZATION postgres;

-- Create users table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS auth.users (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    email TEXT UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    encrypted_password TEXT,
    email_confirmed_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
    invited_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
    confirmation_token TEXT UNIQUE,
    recovery_token TEXT UNIQUE,
    email_change_token_new TEXT UNIQUE,
    email_change TEXT UNIQUE,
    last_sign_in_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
    raw_app_meta_data JSONB DEFAULT '{"provider":"email","providers":["email"]}'::JSONB,
    raw_user_meta_data JSONB DEFAULT '{}'::JSONB,
    is_super_admin BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
    phone TEXT UNIQUE,
    phone_confirmed_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
    phone_change TEXT UNIQUE,
    phone_change_token TEXT UNIQUE,
    confirmed_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
    email_change_sent_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
    phone_change_sent_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
    deleted_at TIMESTAMPTZ
);

-- Create refresh_tokens table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS auth.refresh_tokens (
    id BIGINT PRIMARY KEY GENERATED BY DEFAULT AS IDENTITY,
    token TEXT UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    user_id UUID REFERENCES auth.users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE NOT NULL,
    revoked BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
    expires_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL
);

-- Create sessions table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS auth.sessions (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    user_id UUID REFERENCES auth.users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE NOT NULL,
    token TEXT UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    user_agent TEXT,
    ip_address TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Create indexes
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS users_email_idx ON auth.users(email);
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS users_phone_idx ON auth.users(phone);
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS refresh_tokens_token_idx ON auth.refresh_tokens(token);
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS refresh_tokens_user_id_idx ON auth.refresh_tokens(user_id);
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS sessions_user_id_idx ON auth.sessions(user_id);
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS sessions_token_idx ON auth.sessions(token);

-- Grant permissions
GRANT ALL ON SCHEMA auth TO postgres, anon, authenticated, service_role;
GRANT ALL ON ALL TABLES IN SCHEMA auth TO postgres, anon, authenticated, service_role;
GRANT ALL ON ALL SEQUENCES IN SCHEMA auth TO postgres, anon, authenticated, service_role;

EOSQL

content.text: It seems the DROP TABLE didn't work. Let me try a different approach - recreate the entire schema:

input.command:
docker exec supabase-db psql -U postgres -d postgres << 'EOSQL'
-- Drop and recreate auth schema
DROP SCHEMA IF EXISTS auth CASCADE;
CREATE SCHEMA auth AUTHORIZATION postgres;

-- Create users table with all columns
CREATE TABLE auth.users (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    email TEXT UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    encrypted_password TEXT,
    email_confirmed_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
    confirmed_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
    raw_app_meta_data JSONB DEFAULT '{"provider":"email","providers":["email"]}'::JSONB,
    raw_user_meta_data JSONB DEFAULT '{}'::JSONB,
    created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Create sessions table
CREATE TABLE auth.sessions (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    user_id UUID REFERENCES auth.users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE NOT NULL,
    token TEXT UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Create refresh_tokens table
CREATE TABLE auth.refresh_tokens (
    id BIGINT PRIMARY KEY GENERATED BY DEFAULT AS IDENTITY,
    token TEXT UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    user_id UUID REFERENCES auth.users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE NOT NULL,
    created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
    expires_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL
);

-- Insert test user
INSERT INTO auth.users (
    email,
    encrypted_password,
    email_confirmed_at,
    confirmed_at,
    raw_user_meta_data
) VALUES (
    'revccnt@gmail.com',
    'HASHED_PASSWORD_PLACEHOLDER',
    NOW(),
    NOW(),
    '{"full_name":"Test User","role":"admin"}'::JSONB
);

-- Grant permissions
GRANT USAGE ON SCHEMA auth TO anon, authenticated, service_role;
GRANT ALL ON ALL TABLES IN SCHEMA auth TO anon, authenticated, service_role;
GRANT ALL ON ALL SEQUENCES IN SCHEMA auth TO anon, authenticated, service_role;

-- Verify
SELECT 'Auth schema created' as status, COUNT(*) as user_count FROM auth.users;

EOSQL
docker exec supabase-db psql -U postgres -d postgres -c "SELECT id, email, email_confirmed_at, created_at FROM auth.users;" 2>&1

## Task 4: Test the Telegram backup script

Let me find and test the Telegram backup script:

input.command: find /home/ken/nextmavens-platform -name "*telegram*" -o -name "*backup*" 2>/dev/null | grep -E "\.(sh|py|js|ts)$" | head -10

content.content:
/home/ken/nextmavens-platform/scripts/backup.sh
/home/ken/nextmavens-platform/scripts/telegram-backup.py

1#!/usr/bin/env python3 2""" 3NextMavens Telegram Backup Script 4Backs up PostgreSQL database and uploads to Telegram channel 5 6Usage: 7 python3 telegram-backup.py # Interactive mode 8 python3 telegram-backup.py --auto # Auto mode (for cron) 9 python3 telegram-backup.py --db-only # Database backup only 10 python3 telegram-backup.py --restore # Restore latest backup 11 12Cron (daily at 2 AM): 13 0 2 * * * cd /home/ken/nextmavens-platform && /usr/bin/python3 scripts/telegram-backup.py --auto >> logs/backup.log 2>&1 14""" 15 16import os 17import sys 18import gzip 19import shutil 20import subprocess 21import requests 22from datetime import datetime 23from pathlib import Path 24import argparse 25 26# ============================================ 27# CONFIGURATION 28# ============================================ 29 30# Load from environment or use defaults 31TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN = os.getenv("TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN", "8311565035:AAEMMAmLAHM8L7zCnx42F3J3W4mcUfw4yhQ") 32TELEGRAM_CHAT_ID = os.getenv("TELEGRAM_CHAT_ID", "7809186882") 33TELEGRAM_BACKUP_CHANNEL_ID = os.getenv("TELEGRAM_BACKUP_CHANNEL_ID", "-3876778158") 34 35# Docker settings 36DB_CONTAINER = "supabase-db" 37DB_USER = "postgres" 38DB_NAME = "postgres" 39DB_PASSWORD = os.getenv("POSTGRES_PASSWORD", "NextMavensSecure2025ChangeMe") 40 41# Backup settings 42BACKUP_DIR = Path("/home/ken/nextmavens-platform/backups") 43BACKUP_DIR.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True) 44MAX_LOCAL_BACKUPS = 3 # Keep only 3 local backups 45COMPRESS_BACKUP = True # Compress with gzip 46 47# ============================================ 48# TELEGRAM FUNCTIONS 49# ============================================ 50 51def send_telegram_message(message: str, channel_id: str = None) -> bool: 52 """Send a message to Telegram chat/channel""" 53 chat_id = channel_id or TELEGRAM_BACKUP_CHANNEL_ID 54 url = f"https://api.telegram.org/bot{TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN}/sendMessage" 55 56 try: 57 response = requests.post(url, json={ 58 "chat_id": chat_id, 59 "text": message, 60 "parse_mode": "HTML" 61 }, timeout=30) 62 return response.json().get("ok", False) 63 except Exception as e: 64 print(f"Failed to send message: {e}") 65 return False 66 67 68def send_telegram_document(file_path: str, caption: str = "", channel_id: str = None) -> bool: 69 """Upload a file to Telegram chat/channel""" 70 chat_id = channel_id or TELEGRAM_BACKUP_CHANNEL_ID 71 url = f"https://api.telegram.org/bot{TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN}/sendDocument" 72 73 try: 74 with open(file_path, 'rb') as f: 75 files = {'document': f} 76 data = { 77 'chat_id': chat_id, 78 'caption': caption[:1024] # Telegram caption limit 79 } 80 response = requests.post(url, data=data, files=files, timeout=300) 81 return response.json().get("ok", False) 82 except Exception as e: 83 print(f"Failed to upload document: {e}") 84 return False 85 86 87# ============================================ 88# BACKUP FUNCTIONS 89# ============================================ 90 91def backup_database() -> Path: 92 """Create a PostgreSQL database backup""" 93 timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") 94 filename = f"nextmavens_backup_{timestamp}.sql" 95 filepath = BACKUP_DIR / filename 96 97 print(f"Creating database backup: {filename}") 98 99 # Use docker exec to run pg_dump 100 cmd = [ 101 "docker", "exec", DB_CONTAINER, 102 "pg_dump", "-U", DB_USER, "-d", DB_NAME, 103 "--no-owner", "--no-acl", "--verbose" 104 ] 105 106 try: 107 with open(filepath, 'w') as f: 108 result = subprocess.run(cmd, stdout=f, stderr=subprocess.PIPE, text=True) 109 110 if result.returncode != 0: 111 raise Exception(f"pg_dump failed: {result.stderr}") 112 113 # Compress if enabled 114 if COMPRESS_BACKUP: 115 print("Compressing backup...") 116 compressed_path = filepath.with_suffix('.sql.gz') 117 with open(filepath, 'rb') as f_in: 118 with gzip.open(compressed_path, 'wb') as f_out: 119 shutil.copyfileobj(f_in, f_out) 120 filepath.unlink() # Remove uncompressed 121 filepath = compressed_path 122 filename = filepath.name 123 124 print(f"Backup created: {filepath} ({filepath.stat().st_size / 1024 / 1024:.2f} MB)") 125 return filepath 126 127 except Exception as e: 128 print(f"Database backup failed: {e}") 129 raise 130 131 132def backup_storage() -> Path: 133 """Create a backup of storage volume (tar.gz)""" 134 timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") 135 filename = f"nextmavens_storage_{timestamp}.tar.gz" 136 filepath = BACKUP_DIR / filename 137 138 print(f"Creating storage backup: {filename}") 139 140 try: 141 # Backup Docker volume 142 cmd = [ 143 "docker", "run", "--rm", 144 "-v", "supabase-storage:/data", 145 "-v", str(BACKUP_DIR):/backup", 146 "alpine", "tar", "czf", f"/backup/{filename}", "-C", "/data", "." 147 ] 148 subprocess.run(cmd, check=True) 149 150 print(f"Storage backup created: {filepath} ({filepath.stat().st_size / 1024 / 1024:.2f} MB)") 151 return filepath 152 153 except Exception as e: 154 print(f"Storage backup failed: {e}") 155 return None 156 157 158def cleanup_old_backups(): 159 """Remove old local backups, keeping only the most recent ones""" 160 print("Cleaning up old local backups...") 161 162 # List all backup files sorted by modification time 163 backups = sorted(BACKUP_DIR.glob("nextmavens_*.sql*"), key=lambda p: p.stat().st_mtime, reverse=True) 164 165 for old_backup in backups[MAX_LOCAL_BACKUPS:]: 166 print(f"Removing old backup: {old_backup.name}") 167 old_backup.unlink() 168 169 170def get_disk_usage() -> dict: 171 """Get current disk usage statistics""" 172 try: 173 result = subprocess.run(['df', '-h', '/'], capture_output=True, text=True) 174 lines = result.stdout.split('\n') 175 if len(lines) > 1: 176 parts = lines[1].split() 177 return { 178 'total': parts[1], 179 'used': parts[2], 180 'available': parts[3], 181 'percent': parts[4] 182 } 183 except: 184 pass 185 return {'percent': 'unknown'} 186 187 188# ============================================ 189# MAIN FUNCTIONS 190# ============================================ 191 192def run_backup(auto_mode=False): 193 """Run complete backup process""" 194 start_time = datetime.now() 195 print(f"\n{'='*50}") 196 print(f"NextMavens Backup Started: {start_time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}") 197 print(f"{'='*50}\n") 198 199 disk_info = get_disk_usage() 200 print(f"Disk Usage: {disk_info['used']} / {disk_info['total']} ({disk_info['percent']})\n") 201 202 success = False 203 backup_files = [] 204 205 try: 206 # Database backup 207 db_backup = backup_database() 208 backup_files.append(('Database', db_backup)) 209 210 # Storage backup (only for weekly full backup) 211 if start_time.weekday() == 6: # Sunday 212 storage_backup = backup_storage() 213 if storage_backup: 214 backup_files.append(('Storage', storage_backup)) 215 216 # Upload to Telegram 217 print("\nUploading to Telegram...") 218 for backup_type, backup_path in backup_files: 219 size_mb = backup_path.stat().st_size / 1024 / 1024 220 caption = f""" 221NextMavens {backup_type} Backup 222Date: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')} 223Size: {size_mb:.2f} MB 224Disk Usage: {disk_info['percent']} 225""" 226 print(f"Uploading {backup_type} backup ({size_mb:.2f} MB)...") 227 if send_telegram_document(str(backup_path), caption.strip()): 228 print(f"Uploaded {backup_type} backup successfully!") 229 else: 230 print(f"Failed to upload {backup_type} backup") 231 if not auto_mode: 232 send_telegram_message(f"Failed to upload {backup_type} backup to Telegram") 233 234 success = True 235 236 # Cleanup old backups 237 cleanup_old_backups() 238 239 except Exception as e: 240 print(f"\nBackup failed: {e}") 241 if not auto_mode: 242 send_telegram_message(f"Backup failed: {str(e)[:500]}") 243 244 # Summary 245 end_time = datetime.now() 246 duration = (end_time - start_time).total_seconds() 247 248 print(f"\n{'='*50}") 249 if success: 250 print(f"Backup Completed Successfully in {duration:.1f} seconds") 251 if not auto_mode: 252 send_telegram_message( 253 f" NextMavens backup completed\n" 254 f"Duration: {duration:.1f}s\n" 255 f"Disk Usage: {disk_info['percent']}" 256 ) 257 else: 258 print(f"Backup Failed after {duration:.1f} seconds") 259 print(f"{'='*50}\n") 260 261 return success 262 263 264def restore_from_telegram(): 265 """List recent backups from Telegram and restore""" 266 print("Fetching recent backups from Telegram...") 267 268 url = f"https://api.telegram.org/bot{TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN}/getUpdates" 269 response = requests.get(url, timeout=30) 270 271 if not response.json().get("ok"): 272 print("Failed to fetch updates from Telegram") 273 return 274 275 # Find backup files 276 backups = [] 277 for update in response.json().get("result", []): 278 if "message" in update and "document" in update["message"]: 279 doc = update["message"]["document"] 280 if "backup" in doc.get("file_name", "").lower(): 281 backups.append({ 282 "file_id": doc["file_id"], 283 "name": doc["file_name"], 284 "date": datetime.fromtimestamp(update["message"]["date"]).strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M"), 285 "size": doc.get("file_size", 0) / 1024 / 1024 286 }) 287 288 if not backups: 289 print("No backup files found in Telegram") 290 return 291 292 print("\nRecent backups:") 293 for i, b in enumerate(backups[-10:], 1): # Show last 10 294 print(f"{i}. {b['name']} ({b['size']:.2f} MB) - {b['date']}") 295 296 print("\nNote: To restore, download the file and use:") 297 print(" docker exec -i supabase-db psql -U postgres < backup.sql") 298 299 300# ============================================ 301# ENTRY POINT 302# ============================================ 303 304if __name__ == "__main__": 305 parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="NextMavens Telegram Backup") 306 parser.add_argument("--auto", action="store_true", help="Auto mode for cron (no interactive prompts)") 307 parser.add_argument("--db-only", action="store_true", help="Backup database only") 308 parser.add_argument("--restore", action="store_true", help="Restore mode") 309 310 args = parser.parse_args() 311 312 if args.restore: 313 restore_from_telegram() 314 else: 315 run_backup(auto_mode=args.auto) 316 Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
